answers.answer: im so sorry that she has to go through this as such a young age God bless her will keep her in my prayersif you can give us a little more info about the cyst would be better for advicefirst of all it would be better if she can get check by and obgyn or a gynonc they know

more about ovarian cyst..has she already started her period?most ovarian cyst are benign 90% which is a really good thingalso if talk ti her surgeon about possiblities of saving her ovaries even if only one of themsome cyst special simplecyst resolves on their own thats why some doctors wait for 3 months and give pillsi had surgery last septbr to take out a fluid filled cyst on my right ovary it was 7.5cm it was benign thanks to God

question: My grand daughter was just diagnosed with ovarian cysts. I am just looking for information and insight from experience of others.  I am wondering if such cysts might be related at all to diabetes (not diagnosed, but maybe in a pre-diabetic situation).  An MRI has been done and medicine has been given so doctors can determine if surgery will be required.  She has been told that she may not be able to get pregnant in the future if she has surgery. Much to think about.  Much to pray about.
title: Ovarian cysts in 13-yr old granddaughter
